markdown:
<title
    level="1"
    right="Item 1+"
    pfs="Standard"
>
[Vaccine](/Equipment.aspx?ID=1969)
</title>

<traits>
<trait label="Alchemical" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=6" />
<trait label="Consumable" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=36" />
<trait label="Elixir" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=59" />
<trait label="Healing" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=89" />
</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

<row gap="tiny">**Source** [Treasure Vault](/Sources.aspx?ID=191) pg. 61 <sup>1.1</sup>, [Legends](/Sources.aspx?ID=40) pg. 71</row>

<row gap="medium">

**Usage** held in 1 hand

**Bulk** L
</row>

<row gap="medium">
<row gap="tiny"><row>**Activate**</row><actions string="Single Action" /><row>Interact</row></row>

 

 

 
</row>

</column>

---

A vaccine grants a creature immunity to a specific strain of [disease](/Traits.aspx?ID=46) of a level equal to or less than the vaccine's level, and a +2 item bonus on all saving throws against other strains of the same disease. For example, a vaccine could grant immunity to filth fever inflicted by [otyughs](/Monsters.aspx?ID=327) but would only grant a +2 saving throw bonus against filth fever inflicted by a [giant rat](/Monsters.aspx?ID=346).

 **Special** A vaccine is the same rarity as the disease it's designed to prevent, or as the creature who inflicts the disease if the disease itself doesn't list a rarity

**Craft Requirements** Creating a vaccine requires a sample of the disease in question.

<column gap="tiny">

</column>

<row gap="medium">

**Bulk** L

</row>

</column>

---
